CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 10;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant was a member of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of a session of ORG , the applicant gave a speech in his capacity as a member of the ORG . The purpose of the debate was to take a vote on whether ORG ( PERSON ) had made appropriate use of the DATE municipal budget . In this context the applicant made the following statements :
“ What the members of ORG received is all lumped together ; it is unclear what costs how much ...
According to ORG resolution of DATE , spending on investments was to be increased . The money was to be spent on modernising and renovating the purification plant and building access to it . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant had doubts as to whether that investment had in fact been made . He also referred to another investment project , the sanitary sewage system , saying :

“ It is unclear how many metres have been built . It is important , because this is public money . Everyone knows how to spend his own money , but where public money is concerned , it is being spent as much as possible . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant further compared the GPE municipality with the neighbouring ORG municipality , which had had a small budget but had managed to construct an interceptor sewer at much less expense , which was an example of rational public spending ( gospodarność ) , and said :
“ And this is shocking ; with contractors earning MONEY , is this not money laundering in our municipality ? ”
CARDINAL . The applicant asked the members of the ORG many other questions relating to the DATE budget .
CARDINAL . During a break in the session the applicant gave an interview to a journalist from the local newspaper , ORG ( LOC ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the “ ORG ” published an article entitled “ Where is the CARDINAL ? ” with the subtitle “ GPE municipal councillor accuses ORG of money laundering ” . The article read that “ according to the councillor ’s statement made at the session of ORG , MONEY from the municipal budget allocated for the autonomous activity of the municipality has disappeared ” . The article went on to cite the following statement made by the applicant :

“ ... I made these calculations because there was something not right here , a CARDINAL is missing and I am sure of that . Maybe ORG is money laundering ? I will inform the institutions which deal with controlling the municipalities of the matter ”

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL members of ORG lodged a claim with ORG ( PERSON ) for the protection of their personal rights . Among other things , they sought an order requiring the applicant to publish an official apology in the local newspaper .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment finding that the statements made by the applicant at the ORG meeting on DATE and given to the press had been untrue and had infringed the plaintiffs’ personal rights ( by tarnishing their good name and reputation ) . The court further found that the plaintiffs were public officials and their good name , reputation and reliability were of great importance . It ordered the applicant to publish an official apology in ORG and to make a statement of apology at the next ORG session for his statements made at the CARDINAL DATE session and subsequently reproduced in ORG of DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed against that judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) partly amended the first - instance judgment . It found that most of the applicant ’s statements made at the session on DATE had fallen within the limits of permissible criticism and that the applicant , as a representative of the local community acting in their interest , had had the right to ask critical questions relating to the way public money was spent by ORG . The court found , however , that the applicant ’s allusion to money laundering made during the session of ORG had gone beyond the limits of permissible criticism and that by that statement , referring to a type of crime traditionally associated with organised criminal groups , the applicant had infringed the plaintiffs’ personal rights . The court ordered the applicant to publish an official apology for his allusion to money laundering in ORG and to make the same apology at the next session of ORG .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to entertain that appeal .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against that decision but , on DATE , ORG dismissed his appeal as inadmissible in law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant for making false accusations about another person before a prosecuting body . Notification of the possible commitment of a crime was lodged by the Mayor of GPE .
CARDINAL . The criminal proceedings against the applicant are pending .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Civil Code contains a non - exhaustive list of rights known as “ personal rights ” ( dobra osobiste ) . This provision states :

“ The personal rights of an individual , such as health , liberty , reputation ( cześć ) , freedom of conscience , name or pseudonym , image , secrecy of correspondence , inviolability of the home , scientific or artistic work , [ as well as ] inventions and improvements , shall be protected under civil law regardless of the protection laid down in other legal provisions . ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Civil Code provides for ways of redressing infringements of personal rights . Under that provision , a person faced with the threat of an infringement may demand that the prospective perpetrator refrain from the wrongful activity , unless it is not unlawful . Where an infringement has taken place , the person affected may , inter alia , request that the wrongdoer make a relevant statement in an appropriate form , or demand satisfaction from him or her . If an infringement of a personal right causes financial loss , the person concerned may seek damages .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW , a person whose personal rights have been infringed may seek compensation . That provision , in its relevant part , reads :

“ The court may grant a suitable sum as pecuniary compensation for non - pecuniary damage ( krzywda ) suffered by anyone whose personal rights have been infringed . Alternatively , without prejudice to the right to seek any other relief that may be necessary to remove the consequences of the infringement , the person concerned may ask the court to award a suitable sum for the benefit of a specific social interest . ... ”
